properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 1:13PM PST until February 5 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest to north winds 30 to
45 mph with damaging gusts to 70 mph. Isolated gusts to 80 mph
possible in the foothills of the Santa Ynez range. For the
Freeze Watches, sub- freezing temperatures as low as 30 degrees
will be possible.

* WHERE...Santa Barbara County South Coast.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until noon PST Monday. For the
Freeze Watches, from late Monday night through early Tuesday
morning and late Tuesday night through early Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down large objects such as
trees and power lines. Power outages are likely. High profile
vehicles, including big rigs could be blown over by the powerful
winds. Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, and other
sensitive vegetation.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strongest winds tonight across the Santa
Ynez range and Santa Barbara south coast. Major roadways that
could be impacted by the powerful winds and wind damage include
Highways 101, 154, and 192.
properties.instruction:
People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around
trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of
your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Avoid travel
if possible during the height of the windstorm, and remember to
check the latest road reports if you must travel.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. Plan for
extra time to defrost vehicle windshields.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
